alert.note: Alert for Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:18PM EDT until July 22 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MADISON...SOUTHEASTERN LANIER...SOUTHERN LOWNDES AND SOUTHEASTERN BROOKS COUNTIES... At 318 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Statenville to 6 miles north of Madison, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Park, Madison, Valdosta, Dasher, Naylor, Greenwood, Twin Lakes, Cherry Lake, Hamburg, Pinetta, Valdosta Regional Airport, I-75 At Exit 5, Lovett, Nankin, Empress, Clyattville, Hanson, I-75 At Exit 11 and Stockton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
